author: {'steamid': '76561198807649258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1594705911}
review:
The game is helpful for learning the actual Life board game as I do not actually have the game and the price is cheaper as well, plus the online play and the CPU are great for those without friends to play with. Although there's barely anyone online, perhaps that's just on me for being 
impatient and playing at weird times of the day/night. I still haven't gotten to play with friends with Remote Play, but I may update this review when I do. Also the minigames help differentiate the online game from the physical copy and the version on tabletop simulator.

However I would prefer more types of minigames as this only has 2 at the moment. Also the play style feels extremely slow even with the 'fast' play which is why I don't really replay it as often. It feels like a complete drag. Especially when playing with CPU. Despite all that, I do enjoy the game occasionally but it keeps on freezing whenever I want to restart the game which is a big letdown as I really want to finish the achievements but don't want to wait for the next round to try again and as I said before it feels so SLOW even with fast play on.

So I wouldn't really recommend it until that bug is fixed. Even then I would probably play with the physical copy or on Table Top Simulator with family and/or friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452890146', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1623500060}
review:
THE GAME OF LIFE, ist eine Simulation des lustigen Brettspiels ,,Das Spiel des Lebens“. In dem Spiel müssen die Spieler, wie im richtigen Leben immer wieder Entscheidungen treffen, die Einfluss auf ihren Werdegang haben. Wer im Rentenalter das meiste Vermögen vorweisen kann, gewinnt das Spiel. Verschiedene Karten, die man in dem Spiel sich erspielen kann, geben euch die Möglichkeit, zusätzliches Geld zu verdienen. 
Ich habe das Spiel damals auf Steam geschenkt bekommen, danke dafür, aber zehn Euro für so ein Spiel ist absolut okay. 

Meiner Meinung nach, machen Gesellschaftsspiele aber nur in realer Gesellschaft vor Ort Spaß, trotzdem ist das Spiel ein endloser Klassiker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073303019', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1688363066}
review:
[b] TL:DR: Barely any replayability value, a genuine lack of diversity and seemingly thrown together in a weekend.  [/b]

Painfully simplistic, lacking content and seemingly broken.. College does not help as there are only a handful of careers to pick from, and the game and paths are too short for a higher salary to have much of an advantage over a lower one. The action cards are also lacking diversity and content, and the "action" part of the cards are predictable, boring and somewhat cringey. The rewards of these cards basically render your salary useless as most of the money comes from action cards and minigames. 

Speaking of which... The minigames are too simplistic and lacking diversity, yet I still found myself enjoying the minigames more than the "game" itself. The spinner favors 1 CPU every game, and hardly feels like a spinner; it slows down too quickly and is hard to get a decent spin.. not that it matters because you can drag the spinner to whatever number you want and release to get that number.

review: This is a good game but i felt the animations go on way too long and are far too frequent. There is such a long time between moves. Is just like the classic board game though and plays exactly the same. The fast mode isn't really fast it just adds a score limit. (I exceeded it a lot of times and it never registered) I was kind of hoping for a faster spin and less animation game. Its fantastic with a group of friends but the AI play is rubbish. It has all the components of the classic game but its no where near as good as the actual boardgame. A great alternative if you want to play it online with others or fancy a game but have no one to play it with. 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008549198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1590930477}
review:
A decent PC adaptation of the classical board game, but:
- spinning with the mouse using drag and drop is highly annoying
- the unskippable animations are cute once or twice but get annoying afterwards
- last but not least, I'm pretty sure the CPU players cheat on the RNG

Update: I just noticed that they released a new version a week ago (not as an update, but as a new game). Well, it still has the same flaws. The only improvement is that you can speed up animations and stuff a bit (x5), but it's still damn slow. And CPU players still cheat on the RNG. There it is:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1455630/THE_GAME_OF_LIFE_2/

author: {'steamid': '76561197978302255', 'num_games_owned': 6894, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1587037655}
review:
Habe das Spiel mit voller Vorfreude gestartet, macht auch einen schönen Eindruck, 
aber das wars dann auch schon leider.

Positiv ist die Grafik, kurzer Spielspaß und funktioneller Multiplayer was ja nicht 
immer so ist bei solch Online-Brettspielen.

Negativ haben wir erstmal das Rad was ein wenig matschig zum "würfeln" ist, 
das es nur 2 Minigames gibt und das Schlimmste ist das die Karten sich gefühlt 
nach 3 oder 4 Verschiedenen sich wiederholen

Also um es kurz zu machen, sollten da nicht noch Games und vorallem Karten nachgeliefert 
werden, muss es leider negativ bewertet werden.

Da sind 5€ einfach zu viel -.-

author: {'steamid': '76561198062417900', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1587008855}
review:
It's ridiculous that this game is being sold as the game of life. It's a board game with minor similarities but none of it actually works the same. It's clear that they attempted to make it a conversation starter based on flavor text on the action cards, but it's really just not great. If you want the game of life, just get tabletop simulator and download it for that because this wasn't even worth the $2.99 I paid for it on sale. 

For the record, when I purchased the game last week, the reviews were mostly positive. Clearly this was some type of review bombing because it's legitimately terrible. I have never been so disappointed by a board game turned video game in my life.

review: While it seems to be abandoned by the developer, we didn't have any issues playing local multiplayer.  Really wish it had controller support, because we played on the living room TV but I don't have a wireless Keyboard and Mouse. We kind of worked around it by playing via steam link and passing my phone back and forth, which wasn't ideal but.. it worked.

This piece of software (cant even call it a game) is the biggest fucking POS.  Not even remotely close to being worth $2.50
It literally plays itself. You do not get one single choice in any matters. you don't even spin. the game does it all for you. I sat for 30 mins and watched as the game decided every decision. (this was online mode--full game mode)

The mini games with horrible controls and very very little instructions

The mini games play themselves as well + Not being fun even if you could play/control
(I have not tried pass N play//offline to see if the automation is there as well--Even if it's not the game screwed itself with the online)

Not GFX options--no resolution settings. 

What a complete waste. Do yourself a favor take that two fiddy and save it and buy the board game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074085825', 'num_games_owned': 4493, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1594600698}
review:
Coming from a fairly large family of seven, board gaming was an integral part of our growing up and the Game of Life is one of those classic games I played and loved as a child. Whenever the games were brought out, it was always on the top of my list. The cars and distinct people pegs, that unmistakable sound of the spinner turning, and all of the cool spaces to land on were just a few of the draws that I latched on to. Can that wonder hold up against an older, less forgiving critic?

The Game
I won't go into too much detail as I am pretty sure most everyone knows how the Game of Life is played. In short, the game takes the player from approximately being college aged to retirement, going through life events such as choosing a career, getting married, buying a house and having children. Between the major life happenings, the player can also experience plenty of other events that span the winding game track: some that could qualify as midlife crisis, like buying a beach house or plastic surgery, and other, smaller occurrences such as receiving stock, upgrading a computer, etc. The game ends when all players retire and the person with the most money is declared the winner.

I do want to note that the version that I am basing this review on is not the same version that I used to play as a child. This review will be done on 2002 version using the 10/02 rev.2 rule set and I can only guess at what version I used to play. It was during the 1980's when I was first introduced, so I am assuming that I played that decades version. I do remember driving Chrysler-esque minivans along the board and according to the Wikipedia entry on The Checkered Game of Life, the minivans were introduced in the 1980s reinforcing my theory.

Game pieces
It's not really fair for me to comment about the quality of the game pieces in this review as my "gently used" copy came from a local Savers thrift store at a whopping cost of $3.99. I will say, however, that the spinner has not changed much with this version. If you spin it incorrectly it will jam up and not spin, which is exactly as I remember it. As much as I love the distinguishing uniqueness of the spinner, no one should have to battle against a game to get it to function correctly. I also wish Hasbro would have included additional Bank Loan notes. Between the 100,000 in college loans and having to buy a house only a few spins later, my wife and I managed to eat up nearly all the notes in most of the games we played. If there were more players, we would have had to come up with a solution. It's hard to say if the problem was due to missing pieces when I purchased the game or if it was shipped with what I had, but it looked like the game was only played once before I bought it as only one blue and one pink people pegs had been detached from their plastic housing.

Gameplay
For such a complex looking board, Game of Life is one of easiest board games to understand and play. Spin the Spinner, move number of spaces indicated, and then perform action indicated on the space landed upon. Every turn is that or a variation of that, whether it be stopping for a required Stop space, paying out Pay Days that are passed regardless of stopping on them or not, and landing on an optional-to-play blue space.

There are some differences in this version compared to the 1980s version. One is that stocks certificates are purchasable and the player earns money for each time the Spinner lands on the number of the stock. Gone are the times of buying chances of hitting it big on the betting board, which makes me sad. I enjoyed spinning for the winnings Another variation is that no spins are made for money at marriage and adding children, instead you get Life Tiles (discussed below); how dull. I seemed to remember giving money to the person who ended up getting married first, which added some value to being in the lead. Also in this version kids are absolutely worthless. There is one, maybe two, spaces on the board where you owe money based off the amount of children you have, but other than that, they just add color to your car. And those Life Tiles, what are those about? They only make the game even more random. I could understand if there were more interactions with them throughout the game, like what happens with the Athlete career, but there aren't. There are a few other minor variations, selling your house (for potential profit) and purchasing a new one, night school, and changes in available insurances, but they are fairly insignificant to the game.

Final Thoughts
Whether it be the changes in the rules or just the fact that I am not a kid anymore, but the Game of Life just doesn't hold on to the appeal that it used to have for me. I still find the game fun, but I don't have that wonder of experiencing the story of the game that I used to. My mind is now more focused on critically examining the mechanics of the game and it doesn't hold up as it is completely luck based. It's all in the draw of your career/salary cards, the number that turns up on the spinner, and the value of the Life Tiles at the end of the game. For players who have fond memories of older versions, I would not suggest this version over what you are used to; however, if you have not had the chance to experience this game or want to play it with your children, then I say go for it. Your children will still enjoy this game with the excitement of experiencing all the cool events and will be fun for you as well, just not nearly as much as when you were experiencing it as a child. I give it a 2.5 out of 5.

review: Saw xQc playing this and figured I had to pick it up since it's on sale right now for $2.50. I've always loved the game of life, but it's even more enjoyable when I don't have to worry about misplacing the millions of microscopic plastic pieces, squint to read everything on the board, lean over people, etc. This is a really nice desktop adaptation of the board game. Kinda wish they had multiple tracks instead of the same looping song, but it's whatever for how cheap it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021637318', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1586287190}
review:
The first Game of Life video game was a well done recreation of the board game that was and is fun to play to this day.
This version of The Game of Life video game is an extremely oversimplified hold your hand made for 5 year old's beyond lazy programming half assed not giving a crap cash grabs I have ever seen.
Playing with just people it's ok but if you use any cpu players the lazy programming shows everywhere.
First thing, cpu's will choose player 1 for spinoffs every time, the spins will favor one player every game.
Going to college does not seem to help at all and occupations are not connected to the game in any way.
Small kids may get a kick out of this for a bit but if your looking for a good video game version of the board game this isn't it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198987790692', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1591129389}
review:
ОПИСАНИЕ ИГРЫ:
Залезай в машинку и прокатись по жизни вместе с игрой "Игра в жизнь"!
Объезжай неприятности, делай правильные решения и ты сможешь выйти на пенсию богатеем в этой захватывающей игре на умение и удачу!
Попробуй объехать всю доску, обзаведись всяческими благами, ценными жетонами Жизни и может быть даже семьей.
Но стоит тебе попасть на неправильное поле и ты поплатишься всем своим состоянием.
Игра каждый раз разная. Куда же заведет тебя твой жизненный путь на сей раз? Выиграешь лотерею? Спасешь планету? Или же все твои деньги прогорят на очередном Обвале Биржи? Крути барабан и увидишь. Сможешь сколотить самое большое состояние - выиграешь игру!

Цель игры: стать самым богатым игроком, когда все выйдут на пенсию.

Перед началом игры необходимо собрать игровое поле, установив на него вертушку, горы, мост и строения. Также нужно раздать жетоны Жизни, разделить карты на стопки, выбрать банкира и машинки с человечком для каждого игрока.

Ход игры:

По очереди вращайте вертушку и двигайтесь по доске, выполняя то, чего требует поле, на которое Вы попали.
Выберите, идти ли в университет, или сразу начать карьеру.
Всегда получайте зарплату, когда проходите или попадаете на зеленое поле Получка. Налог платится только, если попадаешь на Поле Налога.
Попадая на поле с надписью Жизнь, получайте по жетону жизни. Оставьте его повернутым лицом вниз!
Останавливайтесь на полях с красным знаком Стоп, даже если у Вас еще остались шаги.
Зарабатывайте деньги, вкладывая в Акции и копите деньги, покупая Страховку на дом или машину.
После того, как достигнете Финиша, выберите, куда уйти на пенсию.
Посчитайте наличные и стоимость жетонов Жизни, чтобы выяснить, кто выиграл! Выигрывает самый богатый игрок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114338311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1530037845}
review:
Ich mag das Spiel sehr. 

Mein richtiges Leben ist nicht so supi, aber mein Leben beim Spiel des Lebens ist einfach hervorragend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071760572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1585549071}
review:
Painfully dumbed down version of a board game I loved growing up. The action cards are nonsensical, cringeworthy, and entirely random making the game have no structure or flow whatsoever. By very far the worst part of the game are the minigames. Boring, very time-consuming nuisances that serve essentially no purpose other than to grind the game to an agonizing halt, they are complete non factors in the final outcome of the game. The only bit of excitement this game offered me was the horror and dread I felt whenever a piece appeared to be nearing a spot  that initiates a mini-game.

I once dropped a five dollar bill down a sewer drain and I felt better about the way I used that $5 than the $5 I spent on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156252355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1585533755}
review: Today was the day that i found out I hate life. This game is so dumbed down my autistic wife was almost able to play it. Drinking water through my nose was a better experience than launching this game. never before have I seen such a wast of a license before and i played E.T on the 2600. Who made this game, i need to know i'm concerned for your well being and mental state. this game looks as good as it tastes it was like shitting out a play doh factory. right from my annus in case you were wondering where from. i beg people not to buy this game as i bought it twice. my friend i gifted it to died from playing this. his final words were MUST SPIIINN.. Because all you do in this game is spin spin spin helicopter babies spin spin spin bank takes your money in a volcano thank youy for listening to my tech talk

author: {'steamid': '76561198119555448', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1588564761}
review:
First of all, let me start this review by mentioning a Steam discussion that happened in the forums for this game. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/403120/discussions/0/496880203079299377/] Here it is [/url] .

It amazes me that when the devs originally released this game onto Steam, they only had hotseat multiplayer and no kind of online whatsoever.  The people who already owned the game wanted to add an online feature and the devs did just that.  I feel like this game would've been bland without the online multiplayer. If you have friends to play this game with, I highly recommend it. I was gifted this game along with 3 of my other friends. We play it occasionally and it's quite fun.  The Game of Life is one of my favorite board games and seeing it on PC in this form is just great.

10/10 devs listened to playerbase

author: {'steamid': '76561199003043777', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1653776937}
review:
DO NOT BUY. Here is why; 
The game was fun I played it with my friend then right when my in game Peg / Person, got married. I realised I wasn't playing anymore. I couldn't control any of my Choices, collect money, and ETC.. I couldn't do ANYTHING. An AI took me over. Which was annoying I ended up leaving in my first few games and I wish I could get a refund.

Things I like: 
It's a nice 3D version of game of life I have the board game for this but, it was nice to not think so hard counting money and moving my arms. 
Not to laggy.
Fun for about a hour.

Things I dislike: 
Gets very boring.
AI can take over.
It does lag when a loading screen happens.
Takes a long time to join a real friend.
No chat (In game)
Is only fun for about a hour.
Costs way to much money for what you get.        


If you like the game of life just buy the board game or, find it on a website or somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325540641', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1702140100}
review:
This is a very nice remake of the original board game. I love the animations and the whole game is kinda cute looking. My only issues are that sometimes the game feels a bit too slow because of those millions of cut scenes. It isn't that bad if you play with friends because you can chat with 'em, but if you play against bots well... it's a bit boring.

I also think that it's cool to have more career options but now choosing between the college and the business road has become pretty useless because you basically can't win with the business road except if you go to the night school in the middle of the game. I also would like to have more than just two different mini games. Plus what's the difference between the Millionaire Mansion and the Countryside Acres??

author: {'steamid': '76561198335121381', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1580939014}
review:
It was a fun at the start, but got stale very quickly. In my opinion it's not worth the money.
Original board game somehow seemed a lot more entertaining.
Another bad thing about this game is that it is bad optimized. Bad performing game with uninspired and lowkey bad graphics. 
There were occasions where players would get disconnected without possibility to join back in the same lobby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024342475', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1580973308}
review: There isn't a lot to say about this game honestly but I do like it. It is a cheap good time with friends and the only problem is that after a few games of it you have mostly seen everything it has to offer. I got it half off so for $2.50 I feel as thought I got my value out of it. It is very much like a board game in the sense that you play it when you need something to play and it just sits around for a while. It is good but you could be playing other things. It runs well enough but the only real problem with performance is sometimes the game crashes and there is no way to join back into the game. This is one of the few games I wish there was a middle option in between thumbs up or down as it is very middle ground.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368311854', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1608773523}
review: cute little game thats nice to play it has a great soundtrack and nice visuals. theres not much in terms of variety for the actual gameplay but the game itself lasts awhile so theres lots to do. Theres not many players so playing online is kind of depressing and playing with the CPU just doesnt feel that fun but the pass and play feature for people irl is actually a great way to play if you want to play with real people. I assume in the future where there are more players that own the game online will improve. The game can get glitchy, sometimes in really bad spots, like the spinner froze for me right at the very end of the game which felt really frustrating but its not frequent enough to be a real issue. The game is nice to play if you can't decide what else to play or you're really bored. Also its worth noting that the acheivements are really easy to complete and you can probably get them all perfect in like 6-7 hrs of gameplay so its good if you like getting perfect games or something. Overall a good game and my expectations were definitely exceeded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408364302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1581296639}
review: This game is basically just like the board game or the app, if you ever played them. If not, then the game, played against other people online or in a pass & play or against CPUs, is aboard game styled game that takes you through life. You begin by picking to go to college or jumping into a career. Going to college costs money, but will give you better careers in the long run. Random scenarios will happen based on the spaces hat you land on around the board, with some forcing you to stop, such as your first career, getting married, going to night school, etc. I grew up playing the board game version of this game, so I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655704', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1704847191}
review:
[h1]Jouez à [i]Destins-ins[/i] pour changer de vie ![/h1]

[i][b]THE GAME OF LIFE[/b][/i] est l'adaptation en jeu vidéo du jeu de société du même nom, "[i]Destins[/i]" chez nous les français. Le principe est le même que le jeu de société : tourner une roue pour avancer sur un plateau et atteindre la fin. En avançant, on passe par les différentes phases d'une vie bien formatée, c'est-à-dire entrée dans la vie active (obligatoire), mariage (obligatoire), cours du soir pour un diplôme tardif et un "meilleur" travail (ou non), enfant(s) (ou non), crise de la quarantaine/cinquantaine (ou non), et enfin retraite (qui ici ne s'éloigne pas de plus en plus en rajoutant des cases sur le plateau...)...woooooooo. Et à la fin, on prend le liquide et les bonus pour voir qui a le plus d'argent et donc qui a gagné.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1926152664
Bref, pour "changer de vie", ce n'est pas le meilleur des jeux. Mais pour passer une petite demi-heure tranquillou histoire de passer le temps, c'est pas mal. On peut jouer en local jusqu'à 4 joueurs, avec ou sans IA, et également jouer en ligne. On ne peut pas changer la difficulté de l'IA, celle-ci est standard et, sans être mauvaise, n'est pas fameuse non plus. 
Il y a deux modes de jeu : le mode classique, qui consiste à atteindre la fin du plateau et avoir le plus d'argent, et le mode rapide, qui consiste à atteindre un objectif aléatoire en premier (par exemple atteindre la chapelle en premier, être le premier à gagner 300K, etc...).
La faiblesse du jeu se trouve dans son contenu, car celui-ci n'est pas très étoffé. Il y a peu de carrières différentes, peu de cartes "action" différentes, seulement 2 mini-jeux différents, et le plateau ne contient pas énormément de cases à parcourir. Comptez un petit 20 minutes pour une partie 1 joueur contre un IA, et 45 minutes pour 1 joueur et 3 IA. Notez d'ailleurs qu'à chaque carte de duel, l'IA choisira le/un joueur à affronter.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1926152366
Du coup, malheureusement, on en fait vite le tour. On relancera le jeu pour jouer une partie ou deux avec les amis, ou pour gagner tous les succès (qui, à ce propos, ne tombent que pour le 1er joueur et hôte de la partie), mais c'est probablement tout. Néanmoins, les quelques heures qu'on passera dessus seront agréables et tranquilles, pour peu qu'on apprécie le concept du jeu au préalable. 5€ n'est pas bien cher, mais je vous encourage tout de même à attendre une petite promo si le jeu vous intéresse.

[code]Vous avez aimé cette petite évaluation? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9753228/]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]

review:
This is NOT the original version. The "Original" version game mode isnt anything near the original game. 
As another reviewers (Katsups) said
"[It] lacks the variety that you have with the original game. You dont get to select your career and salary separate, and stocks arent bought. you're just given one of each depending on what card you draw. There are no life "tiles" and a lot of the penalties are gone. It's too easy & fast." 

I found this game super boring and a chore to finish while the board game is super fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002518385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1575223885}
review:
Das "Spiel des Lebens" ist die digitale Umsetzung des bekannten Brettspiels für bis zu vier Spieler. Dabei gehen sowohl KI Gegner als auch menschliche Gegner. (lokal + online coop)
Die Umsetzung ist relativ gelungen. Grafisch sollte man keine besonders hohen Ansprüche stellen. Manche Animationen wirken nicht nur lieblos, sondern auch noch unnötig. 

Das Rad in der Mitte des Spielfelds wird mit der Maus gedreht, wobei das Spiel leider nicht immer erkennt, wenn es sich nicht um eine akkurate Drehung gehandelt hat. Schummeln wäre also mit etwas Übung möglich.

Obwohl das Spiel sicher kurzweiligen Unterhaltungsfaktor hat, bekommt es von mir keine Empfehlung. Dazu fehlen einfach elementare Erklärungen zu bestimmten Feldern und Auswirkungen, die man erst mal heraus finden muss und weil es an Langzeitmotivation fehlt. Lediglich für kleines Geld, kann man hier relativ unbedenklich zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302019885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1574788636}
review:
This is legit the most boring game I have ever owned.
There is only two mini games to play which both are super boring.
The way of spinning the wheel in the middle is horrible, sometimes it doesnt even register you are spinning so it just does absolutely nothing. 
When you play with friends there is no option to add AI so if you just play with 2 people you constantly have the same repeating things. 
Even after I got this game on sale I 100% do not think it was worth any of my money. 

If you are looking for a fun game to play with your friends this is definetly not it.

review: O jogo representa um clássico de tabuleiro que a maioria dos jovens adultos jogou, tem cheirinho de infância. Porém, é difícil achar partida multiplayer a não ser que você já tenha amigos adicionados que também queiram jogar. Não sei se é devido ao baixo nível de jogadores online ou ao próprio servidor do jogo. Enfim, no geral, é um jogo bem simplório, rápido e divertido quando se joga com os amigos (pra rir deles se f*dendo). Vale a pena comprar (na promoção).

author: {'steamid': '76561198011928327', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1575333638}
review: From the 5 hours I've played I've concluded that this game can be fun with your friends and family but the $5 price tag is a bit much for all that this game has to offer. There are only so much to be done. There is only 2 mini-games within the game so I find that very lacking & repetitive. This game is very lackluster. I do recommend buying it if it is ever on sale for $1.20. However the $5 you'll pay otherwise is kinda like throwing money into a fire. That's about as much entertainment as you will get out of this very dull game. 3/10 just because it made me and my friends laugh for around 50 minutes in total out of the 5 hours I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144702195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1612353804}
review:
The Game of Life

--Vale a Pena?
[  ] Economiza seu dinheiro ou compra cartas na steam
[x] Compra na promoção
[  ] Vale pakas

--Para quem esse jogo foi desenvolvido?
[  ] Kids
[  ] Adolescentes e Adultos
[x] Todos

--Texturas, Gráficos?
[x] Minecraft Redondo, tabuleiro 3D
[  ] Dahora, médio
[  ] Lindo, vida real

--Falhas
[  ] Isso é um bug
[  ] Irrelevantes
[x] Perfeicão

--É difícil?
[  ] Desista é HARD
[  ] Pega o jeito
[x] Fácil é EZ

--Tem uma história?
[x] Nem tem
[  ] Da para se entreter
[  ] Filme

--Audio, músicas
[x] Muta o jogo
[  ] Uns som de fundo 
[  ] Baixei para ouvir

--Trambolho necessário pra rodar (NO MÍNIMO)
[x] Batata 
[  ] Um PC já considerado gamer
[  ] PC Gamer

--Otimizado?
[  ] Nem um pouco
[  ] Parcialmente
[x] Sim  

--Mapa
[  ]Dois passos e acabou
[x] Médio, partida demora uns 20-30min
[  ] Boa sorte para explorar tudo

--Conexão
[  ] Cai mais que minhas notas
[  ] Pode dar umas quedas
[x] Jogue sem preocupação

--Comunidade
[  ] Lixo nuclear de tanta toxidade
[x] Zoeiros, comediantes
[  ] Pessoas formais

OBS: Jogo da vida de tabuleiro versão 3D com umas animação dahorinha e uns minigame bem tosquin, se tiver abaixo de 3 real vale a pena, jogo totalmente 4fun, pra se divertir com os parça verdadeiro e tals, unico ponto negativo ao meu ver, são os mini-game que tem, não tem sentido, fora isso é bem divertido, mute o jogo e bota uma playlist pra tocar e pronto.

--Nota Final -> 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273804369', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1643916829}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146425118', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1638010421}
review:
Весьма неплохая, за свою цену, настолка,в которой можно с удовольствием провести пару-тройку часов.
[h1] Понравилось [/h1]
[b] 1.Задумка [/b]
Суть игры в том,что мы,вращая колесо, продвигаемся по своему жизненному пути и попутно получаем образование,зарабатываем деньги,покупаем недвижимость, создаём семью и т.п. По пути мы подбираем карточки с различными событиями,которые призваны разнообразить геймплей. В конце же подсчитываются наши накопления на основе полученных карточек,рождённых детей,купленной недвижимости.Игрок, сумевший обеспечить себе более достойную старость, побеждает.
[b] 2.Мини игры [/b]
Они так же,как и карточки попадаются нам на пути и вносят разнообразие.Всего существует два вида.В первой мы должны подбирать летящие на нас купюры и уклоняться от нежелательных объектов.Во второй мы подкрадываемся к охраннику и пытаемся либо подобраться как можно ближе,либо вовсе дойти до конца.Учавствуют все игроки и независимо от занятого места получают прибыль по результатам игры.
[h1] Не понравилось [/h1]
[b] 1.Боты [/b]
С ними очень скучно играть.Они довольно глупые,всегда выбирают низкооплачиваемые профессии,все карточки применяют на игрока,не покупают недвижимость, их поведение очень предсказуемо.А ещё их нельзя добавить в игру с другом.
[h1] Итоги [/h1]
[b] Для своей цены игра очень даже неплоха.На неё не жалко потратить время, но я бы советовал брать её исключительно при наличии друзей,желающих поиграть с вами.
[h1] Оценка:7/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027734520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1588467833}
review:
Eh, it's the game of life, but dumbed down to an extreme. It's another mobile game ported to PC.

If the game included an "auto-spin" option, you wouldn't even have to be there to let the game play itself. There's virtually no real "costs" or "incomes", the bank just decides to give you money or take your money depending on what number you spin. The map is short, and the game on the entirety barely holds a candle to the original game activities and experience.

I payed about $2 for this game (on a %75 discount), and I still don't really feel it was worth it. This is more like a .99 cent game off the app store/play store.

Get the board game. You'll have more fun, I'm sure.

review:
"Frauengesang: Jetzt kannst du im Spiel des Lebens Sieger sein.
Rapper: Finde einen Job der dir gefällt, wenn du dich traust wirst du ein Held, steuer ein Club, komm ganz groß raus, leb dein Leben in Saus und Braus, im Casino setz alles ein
Frauengesang: Dann kannst du im Spiel des Lebens Sieger sein
Erzähler: Das Spiel des Lebens, von MB"

Wegen dieser 90er Jahre Werbung in meinem Kopf musste ich dieses Spiel kaufen. 
Habe bisher eine Runde gespielt und war nicht enttäuscht. Eine solide Umsetzung des Brettspielklassikers.
Es war im Angebot und für etwas über einen € kann man nicht meckern.
Man bekommt was man erwartet.

review: Wer das Brettspiel kennt, wird auch die PC-Variante mögen. Man kann alleine gegen den Computer spielen, gegen Leute die ebenfalls online sind, gegen Freunde mit denen man am Rechner sitzt oder auch mit Freunden übers Internet. Es gibt die klassische Spielvariante, aber auch verkürzte Versionen. Alles in allem ein kleines Spiel für zwischendurch bei dem man eigentlich nichts machen muss außer das Rad zu drehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208058901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1673560208}
review: This game is amazing because it is an accurate representation of our modern life. You start right after graduating highschool, you are an 18 year old male or female (unfortunately the game does not allow you to pick a third option), and you are very poor because you only have $250000, with this money you can either start a career or go to college, while college can sometimes land you a higher paying job, it unfortunately costs $100000, which subtracts from your final total. After any additional schooling is done, the game putters along just like real life, until marriage. At this point you are sent into a church and allowed to select either a male or female partner, from there you continue until you are given the option to return to college for an additional $100000 and select a new career, or continue on with your life. The next mile stone is the selection as to whether or not you want children, and this game is an obvious example of how abortion costs us money. Every abortion loses you $50k, and honestly, with the current state of the economy, we can't afford this. Things like this, is why China is winning the trade war, unless everyone has as many kids as possible, our way of life will be extinguished. Once you have acquired as many kids as will fit in your car (a house is optional when raising 7 children with your partner), you continue on until you reach the cross roads of life, here the choice comes down to the risky road or the safe road, the safe road will continue in the monotony of life (random world cruises, law suits, winning $100000 in a pie eating contest, and other ordinary events) or you can take the risky road for a high risk/ high reward. From the risky road, you go home to retirement, which location you and your 27 infants choose to go to, will have no outcome on the end of the game. In addition, if you do not tell me your favorite flavor of ice cream, you are legally obligated to give me $7000.

review:
Just buy table top simulator and download the Game of Life on steam workshop.


This game is too simple, and lacks the variety that you have with the original game. You dont get to select your career and salary separate, and stocks arent bought. you're just given one of each depending on what card you draw. There are no life "tiles" and a lot of the penalties are gone. It's too easy & fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086400790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1590657210}
review: Ganz ehrlich, dieses Spiel kann man nicht empfehlen. Zwar gefällt mir persönlich die fröhliche Musik gut, aber da hört es dann auch schon so ziemlich auf. Der Multiplayer ist nicht funktionstüchtig, weil man seltenst überhaupt Mitspieler*innen findet. Die KI ist grottendämlich, trifft Entscheidungen zu ihrem eigenen Nachteil und wann immer ein Spieler für einen Dreh am Rad ausgewählt werden muss, wählt sie (Überraschung) den echten Spieler ... unglaublich langweilig, und so könnte das Spiel umbenannt werden in "Wir lassen dich gewinnen". Darüber hinaus sind die beiden Mini-Games schon nach kurzem nur noch repetitiv und langweilig. Noch 'ne Portion Klischees gefällig? Bitteschön: so etwas wie gleichgeschlechtliche Ehen im Spiel gibt es nicht - das hätte man ja zufallsgeneriert machen können, aber wo kämen wir denn da hin? Leider ist auch die deutsche Übersetzung der Karten z.T. fehlerhaft, denn statt "Du erhälst 100k" steht oft "Du erhälst [die am Rad gedrehte] Zahl x 100k" was aber schlichtweg nicht stimmt. Schön wären halt auch unterschiedliche Maps gewesen, aber das ist halt auch Wunschdenken. Schade! So hat man nach 2,5 Std. im Spiel wirklich ALLES gesehen, was es zu sehen gibt. Verschenktes Potenzial. Daher meine Empfehlung: kauft es euch nur, wenn es extrem heruntergesetzt ist oder lasst es gleich ganz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006715646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1642905507}
review:
This game has earned a mixed review because of two different reasons.

The first reason which is the positive part of the game is that it does possess creative yet comical cards that do provide bonuses as well as penalties, it also possess amusing mini-games and challenges. These can force the game to be entertaining for one hour or two hours.

The second reason which is the negative part is that the game is too simplistic and it lacked creativity. Basically, the game can be extremely simple to beat and the computer players aren't challenging and furthermore, the game only possessed one theme (classic theme) which can be a problem for players that crave variety. Because of this, the players will experience boredom after 1-3 days.

The verdict is that if you enjoy games that aren't too challenging or demanding, then purchase and play the game. If you prefer more challenging or thrilling games on the other hand, then this is not the game for you.

review:
Grabbed this game during a discount. Fun & simple game. If you want to play online you'll need to find some friends who want to play as online mode is pretty dead.

If you're looking for an easy game to 100% this is an easy one. Took me about 3 hours to complete with the hardest two being having 5+ kids at the end and buying/selling a house. The latter having to be done on the game board and not the end of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114991122', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1580975630}
review: This is great. I don't mind it's not exactly like the actual board game, it still has the same feeling with fun little mini games to race with your friends or computers to win. Along with competitions you have to face off as a whole or one on one. It is a very basic version of Life and plays very well with no problems. The only thing the board lacked was the fact the original board game made you pay for kids if you had them or gained them, those cards don't seem to exist. Which is fine by me, wouldn't be entirely fun on a computer and maybe a bit too long to play. So this being the first I've seen of life being brought to digital, it was done very well. Maybe in the future one will be brought out that is more in depth with a save function like some of the new monopoly games. But, this is worth the 5 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139224379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1564979229}
review:
My girlfriend and I were feeling a little nostalgia crazy and were thinking about the Game of Life 1998. We purchased this game thinking it would bring back the same fond memories. However, this game was an utter disappointment. Everything allows you to just accumulate wealth like the rich upper classes while being something as mid-tier as a teacher. We played on and there were just no consequences. The Game of Life is not this easy. In fact, life is incredibly hard. I struggle every day trying to make ends meet. Where is my $100K paycheck for existing? How come there are no bills for when you have kids? What is this a medicare for all utopia? 

Anyways I give the game a solid 9/10

review: If you like RNG based games this one is for you. I have to say, I've heard about this game on american tv shows and was really looking forward to try it. You can't loose. I don't know how you ever could. Maybe it's a children game, but as an adult you'd resent this piece of crap RNG. Play Sorry if you want RNG because then you at least can strategise. Here you can't even turn of the stupidly long anymations. I played one full game and one short-version. The short version is even more shit so there. Do you like RNG and you don't like loosing? Play this if I care. I'd like my money back. THis piece of crap cost as much as AoE II and that's just awfull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220030719', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1667716511}
review:
lol it's a fun game to play with friends
_______________________________

but when you are an achievement whore like myself....
this game haunts you!!!!
i spent over an hour playing... i had 7 children...
and no, this time i did not threaten to throw them into the volcano while i was on the risky route...
still did not get the achievement for having more than 5 kids.... 
are my emotions a game to you?

(this has happened multiple times, yeah i know my poor in-game character got knocked up so much)

7/10
-1 for not letting me get the achievement
-1 for all the pain this game has caused me
-1 because i feel like it 
+7 because i've had some fun experiences with my friends 
_________________________________________________

so yeah it's worth the emotional turmoil ngl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054520047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1674010401}
review: I've only played the pass-and-play version at home and it's alright. It seems like every space we land on requires us to spin for something, which is a real nuisance since we play on a logitech keyboard with a built in touchpad. It makes spinning the spinner pretty annoying, and there's no way to change it so you can just click something to spin. I didn't enjoy it as much as the actual board game, but it's still the same basic concept and it saves you from having to set up or put away a game board so there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145585552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1562109994}
review:
At first, the game isn't bad. Fun and very reminiscent of the board game with a few things added in like mini games and animations. However... After a few games, it gets old and repetitive. Plus, the online multiplayer is almost non-existent now. You're lucky to find one person to play with online, let alone three to make a full game. And you can only play against the CPU so many times before it gets old. Plus the game hasn't had a major update in what, three years now?

Honestly, if you want to play The Game of Life, you'd probably have more fun sticking to the board game as it'd be a lot easier to find people nearby to play with.

review: Really fun game that takes you back to playing the board game as a kid. Good range of careers and options and it's good to have the option to play with other humans, CPU or even online! The little mini-games are fun too but sometimes I feel like the CPU makes it too easy to beat them! Overall a good little time-killer that doesn't require much skill or concentration - good for a relaxing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054596302', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1654462624}
review:
I purchased this game for my seven year old daughter, who likes playing the board game.  This game has similar rules to the board game, but the most of the game is not the same as the board game.  There are different jobs out of college, different events each time you land on a space.  There's also no way to skip the animations during the game that I've been able to find, so each game you get to see the same scenes for graduating, getting married, getting a baby (dropped from a Helicopter in some cases), etc.

There are also Short Play variants, in case you just want a very fast game of life.  Rather than playing all the way through retirement, you can choose a random end point, such as "First to get married" or "First to earn $750K"  As you would expect, these are pretty heavily dependent upon which person goes first.

You can pay against other people, or against the CPU.  It's still enjoyable, but don't expect the game to be identical to the board game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348363476', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1637753469}
review:
Really, i'm not into these types of games. I just picked it up since it was cheap at the time and my friends said that i should. I really don't know why I listened but i'm way past the 2 hour mark on this game so I guess no refunds for me. Gets boring really fast, and there's really nothing to it other than:

-spin wheel
-get money
-get job
-get wife
-get house
-win

That's literally the entire game summarized.
Now I get that this game is aimed towards a younger demographic, but I'd rather spend my time playing Roblox than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219343843', 'num_games_owned': 16124, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1556051325}
review:
This digital version of the board game by the same name improves on it, offering online and local play, two minigames, the ability to pause anytime, and an abbreviated mode with randomized win conditions for quick-play.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Simple to learn
+ Nice graphics, presentation
+ Randomized events & luck-based elements make no two games the same
+ Skill based minigames add variety
+ Great for all ages

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- After a couple games it can become repetitive
- Viewing the board is awkward, can only be done at start of turn, and can't change angle
- Minigames are great, but two is too few
- The AI is too easy to beat in minigames
- You need a lot of luck to pull off 6+ children achievement

The game is simple: Pick a career, roll the spinner, and make a series of choices along the way (paths, home purchase/sale, re-roll career, try to have children). Ultimately, though, your success or failure will be up to chance. There is a mild element of strategy here if you play against other people, since your final score is the sum of a number of choices you can make.

Fans of the board game will appreciate this digital upgrade, and the ability to play with friends or relatives online. If you're looking for wholesome entertainment for children, this is a great pick.

Achievement Hunters: Pretty easy to 100%, but note the following: First, only the host credits achievement unlocks. Even if you play a local game, 1P must meet the requirements to earn it. Second, the children achievement requires 6 or more ("over 5"), and this is very RNG dependent. Look at the board tiles and restart if you don't have it after you pass all chances to add children. All achievements can be unlocked in solo play. For fastest time, only add one AI opponent. Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198186865498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1549755365}
review:
I played through this as a part of Hasbro Family Game Night on the PS3 a while back and while it was okay for a couple of quick plays at the time, it's a REAL drag as a standalone game. Once you finish the first time around the accumulation of wealth becomes completely arbitrary. Collecting the achievements is the only reason to grind through this slow, slow, incredibly s-l-o-w game. I had to stop two short of getting a perfect game as the 6+ babies achievement was just impossible on single player (the game doesn't allow trophies to work on LAN multi-player).

I could have persisted but the slowness of the game just depressed me. There's no need to freeze on paydays, just keep the game moving! There's no need to hold action cards on the screen for 5 seconds either, just keep the game moving. The lack of variety among the action cards also adds to the overwhelming staleness you'll experience come your second play- through. And why are we playing as creepy plastic pegs? This is a video game! Why couldn't we have a variety of eccentric characters like Monopoly Streets?

Sorry guys, but this dated board game just doesn't work in video game form. I was so fed up with this and the only reason I kept playing was to get those last achievements but the game just won't let you unless you are willing to invest 100+ hours in it. Er...no!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032677858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1557610115}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985474299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1581474163}
review:
Just buy the boardgame.

Yes, this is an accurate, fun, perhaps even advanced version of the boardgame, but the game mechanics leave much to be desired.

Mechanics they ought to add/fix

-Finnicky spin mechanics (The wheel sometimes doesn't do a full turn)
-Make AI turns and cutscenes skippable, or fastforwardable.

I would like to recommend this game, but the amount of time it consumes compared to other games, makes it almost unplayable on account of its tediousness. 

A game should not feel like a grind every time you play it.

review:
So I got gifted this game by my friend, I told him not to but he made me accept it on pain of death.
Then I installed it and... it was not good.
So I launch and join his lobby and we start. Right off the bat the whole 'board' is really low quality, quake had better graphics.
Next the gameplay and there isn't any. Well if you count a spinner then maybe but it's not fun and just luck. 
And to finish it all off my friend crashed finishing our 'long' gaming session.

review:
There's nothing really wrong with this game. There would have to be actual content in to go wrong. This is prety much what it says on the box, execpt its shorter than any other TGOL game, computer or otherwise, I've ever played, even with a full game of friends.
The map is small, there isn't much interesting in the visuals and the minigames don't add anything aside a minute more to a game each. All the 'animations' are so slow as well, like definatley padding slow.
If you have a young one you're buying this for, or if you are a young one defying steams age requirement, then sure this might be a nice braindead activity to wile away some time.

review:
A classic board game revamped for the digital world, with no skill required, some decision making and just a lil luck, its a fun rng race thru life.
The mini games could use a lil work or even just expanded on would be nice, but over all a good family game that can be played and enjoyed online with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147567052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1586981633}
review:
The Game of Life é a versão digital do antigo jogo de tabuleiro "Jogo da Vida" da Estrela da década de 80 que fez a alegria da nossa infância onde jogavamos com os amigos ou com nossa família.

Aqui você escolhe sua carreira, se casa, tem filhos, compra a sua casa, pode se enriquecer ou se endividar; afinal é a sua vida. As animações são divertidas e o cenário é alegre e colorido. 

O ponto negativo fica para o multiplayer pois não encontrei jogadores nas salas mas pelo menos é possível jogar local em até 4 pessoas. The Game of Life deve ser encarado apenas como um passatempo e um bom jogo principalmente para as crianças.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185977479', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1543567626}
review: Wow was this game disappointing. The lack of creativity and emotion in this game... It seems like the developers had a week to throw something together. The textures are jagged, the audio starts clipping, you only have two buttons to control things. I get that maybe it's for kids, but this is a fun board game. I remember playing an iteration of the board game on the ps1 and that game was so much fun. I was expecting this to be a beefed up version of that game. I guess not. Good thing I only bought it for $2.50. Had I known, I wouldn't have even downloaded it if it were free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440547260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1674380433}
review: I was sort of bummed that this wasn't the old Hasbro CD-ROM that I loved so much growing up in the early '00s. In this incarnation of LIFE, the animations are humdrum, the music is annoying, and the non-intuitive UI blocks the view of the board. Really wish this could be played with a controller as well so that it would be easier to play at a party without having to pass around the KBM. Still, can't beat 1.50 on a Steam sale. My wife and I will give it another shot next time we have friends over, and I hope I'll be more persuaded to give this a thumbs-up then. But I kind of doubt it.

review:
Game of the jeu de société mdr, bon les parties normales du jeu dure 40 a 1h selon la chance contre les parties rapides qui durent 15min environ. Un jeu ou que l'on peut s'amuser entre potes  malgré des bots qui veulent vous laissez gagner (apparemment) si vous les mettez (c'est aussi le cas en solo) et personne qui jouent en ligne si vous tentez de chercher des parties en lignes. La traduction est approximative a certains moment mais rien de grave
Bref, je vous le conseille pour faire des parties entre potes (on se tape plein de barres dessus) que çe soit en ligne en partie personnallisé ou en locale.

review:
Really enjoyed it.

Played three games of this and it is good. It is very much like the board game and the graphics are not too bad, as well as the minigames that have been implimented into the game really extend the play time and add some variation to it for a 2 second download it's pretty good. I would recommend this to anyone who wants some laughs with your friends. Although there are some things wrong with the game such as your mouse does not register sometimes, and not to mention one of the matches I played the game sort of "played itself" was rather strange and not too sure what caused it.

review: The game is fun to play with friends! The little minigames are amusing and the game overall is great! I love the option where you can choose to be in an homosexual relationship! My friends and I spent a lot of time playing this until 3 AM in the morning, it was just great! The parkour is fun and there's an option for classic game length and there's also an option for a quick game length for people who don't have a lot of time to spend on it! The game is bright, colourful and very kids friendly! I definitely recommend it for you and your friends, it kills time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1569734888}
review:
The classic children's game online.
Fun as always, and I didn't encounter any glitches or technical problems at all.
Cheaper than buying the physical board game, and with settings that mean you can play together, or for only one player.
Which means: No more disappointment at not having enough players!

review: game is very fun with or without friends you can even play with the members in your house hold or just go up aginst the CPU AI's. its a grat time killer when your bored to death and dont know what game to play so it really helps you think and get your mind back in order... at lest for me anyway X'D so i 100% recomend this to anyone who wants just to sit back and enjoy a relaxing game like this when they've had a had day at work ^w^

author: {'steamid': '76561198283729597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1526277957}
review:
So I don't like to cast quick judgements on games. I like to give them an hour or two, and if I make a mistake and get a bad one (Which I have done a few times) I bite the bullet and accept my losses. I have not refunded a game on Steam.

Until tonight.

I saw a video of people playing this, and decided to check it out. It looked fun enogh, and if it wasn't a complete piece of garbage I probably would get it for a friend so I would have a playing buddy. My optimism at the game was running high. 5 dollars? Pretty cheap, but I could easily get that much use out of it.

That optimism was not meant to last as I started up the game. I click the icon, and lean in, ready for a fun experience playing a game that was a cornerstone of my childhood. I grin as I click pass and play. I don't know anyone who has this, so I set up a CPU, and clicked start. I spin for the right to go first. I am ready to rock and roll

I go second, decide to go to college, and get three spins in. Suddenly, I can't hand money over. I click and click and click. Nothing changes. I assume bug, exit to the main menu, and resume. I do this a few more times, and eventually restart. Same problem, except it was sooner. I did this three times, and it never failed to damper my day further.

I spent the last hour of my life debating if I should write this, before deciding that this is what I need to do. I also decided to refund it. I'm just grateful that I got 5 dollars back. It's 5 dollars I can spend on a functioning game.

Verdict: Buy the real life Game Of Life instead. It's pretty much guaranteed that it'll function better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145758802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1526233528}

review: This game takes me back to my childhood. It was one of my favorite board games. The animations are cute and fun with some happy music to it. I love the random minigames. I don't know if it's just me but most of the time I can't spin it properly due to the circular motion needed with my mouse to make the wheel spin. But all in all I still like this game.

review:
It is fun, but the game is pretty short. It is not the full game even tho it advertises like it is. It is still worth 5 dollars tho if u have friends.

What i mean by not the full game is that it does not include all of the aspects that the board game has. For instance, there are no investments, no starter homes, just homes, all the life cards have the same value, 100k and the board is significantly shorter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077945984', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1510708186}
review:
Ich habe letztens Spaß an dem Brettspiel gefunden und wollte es immer mal spielen können. Da aber nicht immer jemand da ist der mitspielt, dachte ich guckste bei Steam. Fand das für 5 Euro und dachte ja für 1 bis 2 runden ist es bestimmt immer mal gut.

Leider hat das Spiel hier nahezu nichts mit dem originalen brettspiel zu tun.
- Die Figuren sind anders
- Das Spielbrett ist ein völlig anderes (Damit meine ich nicht das 3D)
- Selbst die Geldbeträge sind andere (10x so hoch)
- Die Sachen auf den Feldern, haben nichts mit Spiel des Lebens zu tun

Das einzige was an das Brettspiel erinnert, ist das mit den Berufen und so. Aber selbst da passt es wohl nicht mehr. Scheinbar liegt der Lohn jetzt am Beruf, es ist nicht mehr seperat.

Also Spiel des Lebens ist das nicht mehr. Für 5 Euro kann man es testen, vorallem da man es zurückgeben kann.
Empfehlen würde ich es aber definitiv nicht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198377751155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1563662201}
review: Old school family fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975744883', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1510273968}
review:
Die Idee das "Spiel des Lebens" als Mehrspieler-Videospiel zu veröffentlichen ist an sich eine Gute.

Jedoch weist das Spiel kaum Ähnlichkeiten mit dem Brettspiel auf. Ich habe dieses Spiel für einen geselligen Abend gekauft, jedoch wurden wir schwer enttäuscht. 

Nach einer gewissen Spielzeit hatten wir, noch dazu, den Fehler, dass das Spiel auf einmal anfing alles selbst zu steuern. Klingt zwar wie im echten Leben, macht aber keinen Spaß. Somit konnten wir uns zurücklehnen und unserem Leben beim Spielen zu schauen.


Dann wohl doch lieber Monopoly für den PC kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027847388', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1504325795}
review:
If you want to play The Game Of Life on your PC, then this game is probably the best you'll get on steam.

It is enjoyable to play with the expected excitement of playing The Game Of Life with the physical board game.

It feels bareboned and simplified though and I would've liked if they put more features in it like more minigames.

Overrall though, I feel like this is a pretty enjoyable game. Can get boring to play it again and again, but it is one that is great to play from time to time.

I would say this is a 3/5 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007199567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1548617574}
review:
Spiele es ab und an mit meinem Sohn (unter 10). 
Es macht ihm Spaß und ist ein ganz witziger Zeitvertreib für wwischendurch.

Aufgrund der geringen Anforderungen gut für unterwegs auf leistungsschwächeren Geräten.

Langzeitmotivation ist zugegeben (wohl für Erwachsene) nur in geringem Ausmaß.

Wenn man weiß für wen so ein Game gemacht ist - vorrangig Kinder - dann ist es durchaus empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998344366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1503744468}
review:
Fairly loyal to the traditional board game but the game gets repetitive VERY quickly. There seem to be only two minigames for the minigame spaces you can land on, and they are definitely not built for laptops with trackpads. They get old FAST. Would be nice if there was an option to turn off animations so you don't have to see the graduation/wedding/chilren animations over and over again for every player. By and large it has little to no replay value, much like pulling out the old hard copy of the board game. An occasional fun time.

Note that online functionality seems to be COMPLETELY disabled/gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319845730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1589834584}
review: I've always liked The Game of Life. It's very simple, but also very fun. The problem is, I never liked setting up all the tiny little peices required to play! So this was great for me. The graphics were great, and the short video clips that were attached to  life events such as marrage, graduation, and child birth were very cute. One of the perks of the virtual game are the mini games which can earn you bonuses if you land on the right space. However, if you play this game too often, you might get bored, as there are only so many game outcomes available to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150614078', 'num_games_owned': 1733, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1569289473}
review:
Неплохая элементарная настольная игра, достаточно грамотно преподнесенная в видеоигровом пространстве.
Одним из плюсов является мультиплеер, упущенный в стимовской Монополии, но эта игра намного интерактивнее и интереснее пресловутой "Торгашки", ибо имеет в себе дополнительно ряд мини-игр - состязаний, состоит из сплошных моральных выборов и оставляет за собой право и стимул реиграбельности.
8,5 из 10.
Мини-игр можно было бы и побольше добавить, но это лирика.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078783347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1562088318}
review:
I got this game as a gift from a friend for Christmas and I'm honestly not sure why it has such bad ratings. I played the physical board game of LIFE as a kid, I'm a massive fan of this game, which is why my friend got the computer version for me. This game is actually a really nice, relaxing way to spend an evening. It stays true to the original spirit of the board game and has added some creative minigames and a few extra features that weren't present in the original physical board game, which was a welcomed surprise for a seasoned player like myself. Oh, and major props for being able to choose your spouse's gender, regardless of your own gender. LGBT visibility is always a major selling point for me and I wasn't expecting that kind of progressiveness in a board game that was originally made in 1860, with the modern version we know today being released in 1960. Big thumbs up for that!

On top of the extra minigames and neat features, including being able to play online with your friends, it's just a really nice-looking game with a good soundtrack and cute cutscenes and animations for big events in the game, like getting married, graduating from university and having children. I found the entire thing really enjoyable and I was a bit sceptical going into it just because I am such a huge lifelong fan of The Game of LIFE and I didn't want to be disappointed. Not only was I not disappointed, I was actually pretty impressed. For the $5 it costs, it's a fantastic steal to add to your library if you're a fan of board games.

The only criticisms I can think of for it are when you're playing against computers, they can take their turns a bit too fast sometimes and I can't always follow exactly what they did on their turn. It would be nice if that was slowed down by just a couple seconds. Also, buying a house seems to be optional rather than mandatory in this version of the game. Not 100% sure if there was a rule change in 2016, my tabletop version of the game is a few years old by now.

Anyway, this game's bad ratings are completly unfair and silly. I don't understand it at all. If you like board games, definitely add this to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187683113', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1532228376}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030460140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1467327141}
review: Nice casual game, but I have to say I'm a little disappointed in it compared to the version I used to have. Many years ago, I had a version of the Game of Life that I got literally from a cereal box, and it was one of my favourite games. I bought this one during the Summer Sale expecting that it would be similar, and unfortunately, I was disappointed. My older version had more interesting cutscenes/animations, more and much better minigames, and generally better content. This one was quite bland from a gameplay standpoint. Aside from the two minigames, everything was "spin to find out how much you gain/lose" and the same cards were shown repeatedly. There was a lot less variety in what could happen than in my previous verison of the game. I also didn't really like how it tried to enforce players to be social, by putting things on the cards such as "hug everyone to say thanks" or "Describe your dream vacation and then spin the wheel." Obviously I'm well above the target audience for the game, but I was hoping it would be more similar to the real-life board game. I'd recommend this only if you're looking for a quick, simple game but it isn't the most entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133144835', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1466223117}
review:
[h1]A very odd and unsatisfying rendition of a beloved classic.[/h1]
[b]MY RATING[/b] | 0 out of 5
[b]WORTH THE FULL PRICE?[/b] | No. I actually returned this one.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

I played it with my parents and only finished it because I felt obliged to. This 2016 edition finds a way to make the players feel like spectators and generally disjointed from the experience. I've owned several other PC versions of this board game that were way more interactive than this. I believe that Atari's 1999 version seriously blows this one out of the water which is sad considering technology has advanced SO much since then.

There is very little that the user actually does then just click through dialogs. Some of the other editions find an interesting way to make you feel more attached to your choices. That is not the case with this 2016 edition- you choose a faceless peg and watch it drive around the board. To say there is no personality to this game is a gross understatement.

The most cringey addition are the odd prompts they've added to LIFE cards. I awkwardly laughed through forced interactions like "choose an opponent and compare your best karate chop". We also had incredible difficulty with the spinner which probably accounted for an additional 15 minutes of gameplay. I was happy when the game was over and promptly returned it.

I LOVE board games but I do not recommend this version at all. It seems like a shell of a game and even a bit transactional...which is not a feeling I attribute to fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006075404', 'num_games_owned': 2508, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1465740376}
review:
[h1]Real Review - Real life is more exciting than this[/h1]
Purchase: $3.34 on special on Steam
Hours Played at Review: 3.5
Achievements: 10/10 - another 100% game
Fun Factor:  1 hour, the rest was an interminable grind
Trading Cards: Yes

The game of LIFE board game was one of my favourites growing up and there is plenty that could have been done around the cards you pick up on the board to make them fun and interactive but I'm sorry that I expected something better than this version which makes the one on my iphone look good (and I thought that was a waste of money).

The animations are cute and kid friendly but they draw out an already unengaging experience and make it more painful than watching golf, particularly as you watch the same animations without a speedup or instant click through for each player whether human or npc and unlike the board game where spinning was fun, here it's just another chore.
 
The minigames are a neat diversion from the monotony but occur too infrequently to save this and after the first hour I was simply playing to get the last two mini game achievements for 100% and idling to get the last trading card before uninstalling.

In every game bar one I had the same job and there seemed very little variation or reason to want to play again.  I had played and won games with 5 kids, no kids, having gone to college, been a farmer etc.

If you have a spare wall in the house spend your $5 on a can of paint and watch that dry, it will be far more entertaining.  This started with a fun concept that could have made a quick, casual game and somehow managed to suck all of the life out of it, forgetting that  games are supposed to be fun....

author: {'steamid': '76561198215569203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1462984415}
review:
Если выбирать между настольной игрой на компьютере и настольной вживую, то конечно лучше вживую. Переставлять фишки,брать карточки, видеть реакцию соперников. Но если нет такой возможности, сойдет и компьютерная. 

Признаюсь сначала было интересно играть, каждый раз открывая что-то новое. Но через 10-20 пройденных игр стало скучновато. К сожалению на ней можно играть с друзьями только по одному компу. И это ухудшает игровой процесс. А я покупала надеясь играть по сети. 

5/10 . За 100р ещё можно купить, но не более.
